text: We've been coming here for years and the good quality, in food and service, has been very consistent. Everything we've tried on the menu has been good.

This is a wonderful breakfast spot. Couple colleagues took me here before our meeting downtown. I had there stuffed special berry French toast with some eggs and hashbrowns. The food was more than satisfying for a morning  meal.it  wasn't so crowded since I assume it was a weekday morning.  The restaurants in a quite a lovely neighborhood with a few other shops down the road. Definitely recommended for anyone in the area or visiting Chicago.

Great breakfast diner. Was so good we came two days in row. Both days it was very busy but the service was excellent and the food was even better. I got the breakfast sandwich on a croissant with spicy pepper jack cheese. It was decadent. The hash browns are heavy and fresh. Each order is massive . The server kept our coffee cups full of steaming hot black coffee. It safe bet and a great place to start your day in the Windy City.

Great breakfast spot, very spacious, shockingly so. Fluffy pancakes. Very kid friendly. Heard the dinners are good here. Will come back. Very friendly. Very nice staff. Very good service. Downside - could use more than one stall in the toilet for colon loads. It is an old building so do understand.

The staff was great and the table turn over very quick. So yo don't need to wait hours in line to get seated. Great for kids as the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming plus they have activity sheet and crayons . The food come out fast. The kids pancakes with chocolate chip is huge and delicious (I recommend one order for 2 kids under the age of 7).  I ordered the huevos con chorizo and it tasted good but it is not what I am used to . I looked other orders around me and they look great and people where very satisfied. For tea drinkers they serve full leaf tea which is delicious .
A good breakfast/lunch choice for a prompt service no nonsense neighborhood restaurant. Service is quick and portions are large and served hot.  Try the Denver omelette.

I struggle to understand why this place has the wait that it does.  Sure it has that old school diner feel, a rarity in the city.  And it is an Old Town icon at a time when the Benchmarks and Steak Bars begin to crowd out the long standing staples.  But once you get past those sentimental points, you realize that Nookies fails to deliver what any good restaurant must: good food.  Having lived in the neighborhood for several years, I've eaten here a lot.  And over time the food has ranged from mediocre to outright awful.  Most recently the eggs were way overcooked for the whole table; poached eggs should not have a hard yolk. The toast was even bad, barely toasted and kind of soggy.  Breakfast, which is Nookies' domain, is incredibly easy to make and yet they routinely struggle with even the basics. You can properly poach an egg at home without much effort--and you can certainly toast bread--and it won't set you back $20.

We ate breakfast here and I am so happy that we did! Their portions are seriously huge! The wait was only 15 minutes and completely worth every second.  I ordered the Denver omelet with fresh squeezed orange juice. I loved this place and honestly will make it my first stop in Chicago the next time I am in town. Our waitress was so sweet and we really enjoyed the entire experience.

I have now gone to two Nookies, Old Town and Bryn Mawr. They are not the same. The food and service are good in both and the differences are both in size and atmosphere. The Old Town one is the original. It seems like a house converted to a restaurant ( I could be wrong but the atmosphere is like that.) The outside seating is very relaxed an casual. There was nobody eating there that seemed to have an agenda. I sat at the counter and was comfortable. In the northern one I am aware of being alone. This one envelopes me and I fit better.  Both are good for whatever your needs are. This one is more homey for me.

Nookies is a good brunch option in the neighborhood, with larger portions, and quick service. We came as a group of 7 at about 10 am on Sunday and ordered a mix of sweet and savory items.  My wife and I ordered the southwest omelette and the berry brioche stuffed French toast. Both items were good but I would order the omelette with spices (jalapeño maybe) to give it a kick, though the avocado on top was great. It was stuffed with cheese, beans, and tomato. Also, the hash browns were quite plain so maybe some seasoning in addition to ketchup would help.  The French toast was good but not as moist as I was hoping, and the toast was thinner as opposed to a thicker style toast which I personally prefer. It included strawberry, blackberry, and strawberry. No maple syrup needed as it was drizzled with berry sauce and fruits.  Prices were a bit higher than what I expected given the casual diner vibe and layout (as I'm accustomed to River North), but the positive is that there are plenty of options on the menu.

We went 7/29/17 to celebrate a birthday. We had 16 people plus 2 high chairs and we only had to wait 10 minutes!!!! Our waiter did not write down a single order yet everyone got exactly what they ordered even the "please add....."! Service was very fast. Portions are very generous! We brought in our own dessert and they happily brought us plates & spoons! My favorite is the huevos rancheros: so so fabulous! The veggie & Greek omelettes were excellent as was the corn flake French toast! The waiter, without being asked, brought our 3 yr old her chocolate chip pancakes first, though it was t too long before all else showed up. A very thoughtful and smart idea! Excellent service, very Fast and efficient!
Not much flavor. :( shame because I really wanted to like it! Also holy moly they have the biggest menu I've seen in ages.

Based on the other reviews we were very excited to head to nookies - we were a little disappointed though, although their food is good it is quite basic, it could use a little more flavor and spice to it, seems to me like a simple normal diner

Stopped in for a quick breakfast today!  The service was great with person who seated me asking if I want anything to drink.  My server was Charlie and what a great person to have on staff.  He was super friendly and very efficient. I ordered the omelet and it was huge.  I'm glad I stopped in during my busy day.

Really great local brunch place with character. Prompt and attentive service, and lots of coffee refills. Food is solid and delicious. It's right next to the Lincoln Park Zoo and the waterfront - great idea to take a stroll there after a hefty brunch!

We have had breakfast here many times and are always pleased with the quality and quanity of the food, the service, and how quickly they get it to your table even when very busy. They have a great variety of breakfast offerings, and we have tried most of them. If you are not a big eater you might want to share a plate. Servings are big! We will certainly return here for breakfast whenever we are in Chicago.

It was a Monday and we were looking for a place to have a late lunch in somewhat close proximity to Lincoln Park.  Based on the other Yelp reviews, we picked Nookies. Here's what to expect: - Inside it's a typical diner, but the menu had a good mix of breakfast and lunch items. - Food was really pretty good.  My daughter and I split both the Amsterdam burger and the Artichoke Fritatta.  We also got soup with the burger.  Both meals were really good, especially the fries which I asked for cooked extra crispy.  My wife had the Wild Bleu omelette, and really like that too.  The only thing that wasn't that great were the hash browns (a little mushy) and the $2.75 per cup coffee (which was ok but nothing special). - Service was pretty good, but it should have been as there was hardly anyone in the place. Bottom line:  Not bad...a solid diner experience with a good menu and well cooked food.
Really great place to eat. Nice vibe, pleasant staff and fresh and well made food. Will certainly go back.

The essential diner experience in Chicago. They have 2 other locations. This is where I go when I want a traditional American Diner breakfast. They have excellent breakfast, and I tend to go for their skillets. For the price, it's a great value, and better than most diners of this sort that I've been to in Chicago. Best value and best diner in Chicago!  My go to for that greasy spoon breakfast experience. 4 stars because the food isn't exactly groundbreaking. It's just the best diner of it's type in Chicago. Other considerations if you're looking for the diner experience: Dove's (Even better, but pricier), Cornerstone Cafe (little pricier but more upscale), Crosby's kitchen (pricier)

Cute little place with excellent service! We stopped in for a late breakfast with our 11 month old baby. They helped us in the door, had a good place to park our stroller, sat us immediately with highchair ready to go, water and coffee a few seconds later, and took our order as soon as we were ready. Food was perfectly done to our tastes, with delicious strawberries to keep baby happy. Never had a smoother dining experience with a baby in tow (and our guy is pretty chill). Baby's favorite parts were the strawberries and ceiling fans.

Priced waaaayyyy below the neighborhood and especially for the quantity you get. We sat outside and the waiter was great. I ordered a club sandwich, it was a only like $12.95 and it came with a side of fries and soup. My friend got an omelet and it was insanely big, supposedly four eggs but looked like at least six. Plus, side of perfect hashbrowns and toast.  Highly recommended.
The service was good, but the food was not.  When the best part of breakfast is the pineapple you know you have a problem. The toast was burnt, gravy was runny, and the food was pretty bland.

I work down the street and decided to try Nookies for lunch a couple weeks ago. I ordered at the counter for carryout and the food was ready in about 5 minutes. The caesar salad had crisp lettuce and was larger than I expected for a starter. I also was offered a side of bread with it which I appreciated. I love fried foods so I tried the fried ravioli and was not disappointed! Usually fried ravioli comes with a side of warm marinara sauce, but this was served with a side of salsa. I liked the salsa, but the ravioli were also delicious to eat plain.  All in all, it was great for lunch, especially since my carryout order was ready so quickly.

I recently opened a new real estate brokerage just a couple of doors north of Nookies, so it's quickly become one of my go to meeting spots with clients.  They area always quick, and attentive to our needs.  I'm usually there for breakfast, and the Amy's and North of the Border Omelettes are pretty awesome!  You should check it out when in the neighborhood!

Sitting by the window in nookies almost feels like a scene from a movie. Cute little restaurant in a tree-lined street, surrounded by a mixture of old brick buildings and a few high-rises.  Very charming little spot with friendly service and good food.

Cool little neighborhood brunch spot located slightly east of the park and zoo.  Great Service, and definitely felt more like a diner. Menu has tons of offerings so we mixed it up with breakfast, and lunch. Ordered some waffles and a sammie which came with some soup and fries. The sammie was chicken with onions spinach and gouda. Not my favorite but it also came with a soup, which was creme de broccoli and boy was that good.  Not bad.!

What a city diner should be. Virtually everything fresh and made in house. Tremendous thick cut hashbrowns cooked to perfection. A very respectable eggs benedict. My buddy's omelette was enormous and reportedly delicious.

The food in this restaurant isn't that bad...I try their spring trio and salmon skillet. Wasn't that favor on the skillet but the spring trio isn't that bad. You be able to try three different toast. I would come back here again to try other food.

First time here. Came on a Sunday morning around 11 and there was a 30 minute wait, but we got seated right away at the counter. Generous serving sizes and was great for a hungover Sunday morning. I got the Huevos con Chorizo and it was really amazing. My friend got the Veggie omelette which he enjoyed, and it looked huge!

Great neighborhood brunch spot with a variety of options! Everything looked so good on the menu it's hard to only order one thing! Ambiance: It has that local neighborhood diner feel. Super busy on a Saturday morning especially since most places open at 11am for Brunch. Pay for park street parking.  Food: I got one of the spring specials which was the Paris Benedict. Poached eggs on top of crisp bacon, roasted asparagus, melted gruyere cheese on top of brioche served with roasted potatoes. The poached eggs were so soft that it broke open upon contact. The yolk came streaming down allowing the brioche and potatoes to soak it up. The roasted asparagus and crispiness of the bacon added diverse texture to the dish. Overall, really good and moderately priced!  Service: Good and fast. Coffee was always filled!

Highly recommend getting the jalapeño corn cakes if you go for breakfast/brunch. I got a yummy cheddar, spinach, and bacon omelette (which was very large and was two meals for me), but had the taste of the the jalapeño corn cakes. Holy cow. They are delicious. They are sweet, and not at all hot (and I'm a wimp for spiciness). Seems an odd combination, but man are they good. Service was good, people friendly. But most importantly, jalapeño corn cakes.
Good service but the food was just ok. I got the "farm eggs" and there really wasn't much to it. The coffee also tasted sour.

Great brunch food! Delightfully different menu items that tasted so good! I got the frittata and strawberry waffle to share and would highly recommend them both. There is something for everyone on this menu. If I lived anywhere near that area, I'd make it a regular spot. I'll be back for sure.

Nookies is an Old Town staple.  I've been going here for over a decade and I have never been disappointed.  I have had some of the best pancakes, French toast and crepes here.  You can never go wrong by ordering something sweet for breakfast at Nookies.  The prices are on point for the enormous portions you receive.  And, for the casual drinkers and borderline alcoholics, it's BYOB. Additionally, Nookies is open from 6:30am to 10:00pm and offer a diverse breakfast menu, including numerous vegetarian options, all day, as well as a full lunch/dinner menu.  The staff is friendly, and although the line at the door is sometimes cumbersome, it moves quickly. Definitely stop by for the best breakfast on the north side.

My son hit here on Saturday morning before flight back to North Carolina. I got the Wild Bleu Omelet, and my son got the Hangover Helper (watch it, he's only 15). They were both awesome. Atmosphere and personnel were great.

My husband and I went on a Saturday for brunch. We got seated and received our food quickly, which was nice. We both ordered the Dixie Benedict, egg Benedict is my typical breakfast of choice. However, this one was not good. The taste just wasn't good. Also, the coffee wasn't good either and we love diner coffee! Definitely bummed about this place because we had high hopes!

The servers here are plain rude and the food is terrible. I ordered a chicken sandwich and the chicken in it tasted stale. The fries had been refried many times over and were limp and soggy on the plate. When I told the waitress that my sandwich was stale she took it away but then hovered over my table with another waitress saying the word ' stale' over and over. She then came over to tell me that they had tasted it and it was not stale! What happened to 'customer is king'? They then went on to discuss the episode amongst themselves again making sure I could hear them and said the word 'stale' another 10 times. Never going here again!

Not sure why this breakfast/brunch place is so hyped up. The food just okay, nothing special. I think there are other better, no-frills, brunch options in the area. I was a little disappointed by the offerings on the menu, and then the meal itself wasn't that great either. It is a cute little spot though.

It was a busy weekend morning and Spiro went out of his way to take care of our needs, while expertly attending to all the other customers at the same time. Overall great experience with great service.

Yelp Elite Francis and Belle reviews are spot on.  My wife ordered an omelet and I ordered an overpriced French toast where Nookies charged $7 ($3.50 for strawberries, $3.50 for blueberries) to add fruit without informing me that it would be an extra cost. Overall, the food was just okay. It's likely a popular destination with Old Town neighborhood locals, it has the diner feel and has ample seating. The portions were very generous but the food wasn't anything special. Try Over Easy or Bryn Mawr Breakfast Club if you're willing to make the trek a bit north if you want more flavor in your food.

Walked in and got greeted by the owner and was thanked for coming in! Already I felt appreciated.  Had a home feeling to the place. Ordered the coffee wasn't that great hence my 4 stars. I moved along to the food. I ordered French toast and it was delicious. My daughter had French toast with cornflakes. At first she wasn't sure but when she tried it she scarfed it up . It's hard to impress a 5 year old so mission accomplished. My other kids had burgers and they looked and tasted amazing. The orange juice I have to say was the freshest juice I've ever tasted. So in conclusion food and service was perfection!

This is a great no-frills, old-school brunch spot. It doesn't try to be anything more than it is. It doesn't try to make its food look beautiful. Doesn't try to be hip or modern. Just churns out incredible food. I went here with my dad, who used to frequent it 30 years earlier with my mom as newlyweds. Apparently the quality has not declined. Fresh squeezed OJ at the onset of the meal was incredibly refreshing and used high-quality juicing oranges - no Tropicana here!  My dad had the Copenhagen seasonal special which was big and delicious, while I ordered the Cajun Eggs seasonal special, also big and, in my opinion, even more delicious. Now, admittedly, neither of these are health foods. But boy was mine incredible. Corn pancake/hoecake on the bottom, perfectly runny eggs on top, followed by andouille sausage cajun gravy and a shrimp skewer. Holy moly! Get there while they still have these.  The staff is friendly and accommodating. Prices are not super cheap but very reasonable, especially given the large portions. And we waited a grand total of 5 minutes for our table late morning on a Saturday.  Overall, a fantastic experience!

Early flight into Chicago and was craving a breakfast place before meetings. Such a cute diner with the sweetest waitress in the world. If you're looking for something low key with good diner food, this is your spot. I'll be back in the morning!
Second time this week I have been here this week, lunch and dinner.  Nothing super fancy but very good to say the least.   Food was served fast and fresh.
Basic neighborhood breakfast place. They change up the menu plenty, so there's decent variety...and the menu is pretty comprehensive. Good isn't spectacular but it's a good reliable family place.

Sunday breakfast perfection.  I stopped in Nookies for a Sunday brunch when my father was in town. Breakfast is his favorite meal of the day and Nookie's did not disappoint.  Tucked away on a corner in Old Town, it is your classic low-key neighborhood brunch spot. We both had omelets and they were eggcellent. :) Be forewarned, the food comes out pippin' hot. One of us burnt the roof of our mouths on the first bite.  We'll definitely be back!
Innovative menu with fresh ingredients. Large portions. ..might want to share.  Excellent!

This place is hands down, the best breakfast, lunch and dinner place in the Old Town area! Great staff and friendly atmosphere! I highly recommend the Chicken Caesar Salad and the Burger!! The breakfast bowls are amazing too and I'm a big fan of their coffee. If you're looking for just a casual cozy place to catch up with friends, I would highly suggest going to Nookies in Old Town!

I don't usually write reviews but I was really disappointed by the overall experience. The greeters at the door were friendly but the service was awful, and I would have overlooked that had the food made up for it...but it didn't. I got the eggs benedict and it tasted overwhelmingly like lemon which was extremely off-putting. My boyfriend had the coffee, which he said was sour and his huevos rancheros were bland. We will not be back.

This is absolutely the best breakfast food in the city.  Every time I have family in the city I bring them here and they always come back when they're in town.  Amy's omelette is usually my go to here, but their seasonal food specials are also fantastic.

I would highly recommend the Beef Stroganoff - served with a shredded style beef and delicious homemade mushroom sauce.  The potato soup was good as well.  Definitely will come back!  The service was great as well (sorry I broke the light!)

Great little neighborhood diner, just stick with the classics. This isn't the place to go for fish or anything fancy. I've tried that stuff and I'm always disappointed. Go with pancakes and eggs or grilled cheese or that kinda thing--diner food; the classics are excellent here! Have always had friendly service and love sitting outside during spring and summer months.

We had a very unfortunate experience with Nookies, a restaurant we have patronized for decades. We planned a gathering for the morning after Christmas and were told to call approximately an hour ahead--no reservation was possible. If we called, they said they would set up a table for our group. The day arrived and we called and were told that no such arrangement could be made. So, approximately an hour before our guests were to arrive we had to cancel the event. Needless to say we were quite upset.   Not only were they unwilling to accommodate us, they were rude and dismissive. They acted like I had made the whole thing up. Sadly, I will not be taking my business there any longer.
The good: location, cozy diner vibe The not so good: service and food are both mediocre The bad: coffee

Nookies is your classic, low-key corner breakfast spot located just north of the big Old Town strip on Wells. It's definitely not a destination brunch spot in the city, but you know you'll get some decent grub and friendly service Their menu is really extensive: pancakes, french toast, omelettes, skillets, benedicts, sandwiches, burgers, you name it. I got a nice cheddar and spinach omelette with hash browns and toast. Big portions, so come hungry! I'm a fan! (insert thumbs up emoji)
Always a great stop for early morning breakfast in Chicago. Clean, comfortable and excellent service.  Really cannot say more...so good!

I had the Hangover Helper, which included hash browns topped with chili, eggs, and cheddar cheese. I thought it was pretty decent/similar to other diner food. Prices were relatively good for their portions.
Loved the gluten-free pancakes and hash browns. Fast and friendly for sure! We visit Nookies every time we're in Chicago. Great staff!

Came here for brunch. This place wasn't bad at all. The omelettes are very good and portions generous (which they should be based on prices). My only gripe with the place was the lack of waiting area.  It's hard to wait outside in the cold for diner food that, while good, I can get at a lot of other places.

We came here for breakfast on a Tuesday. We were greeted by an extremely friendly host and sat immediately. I got the special, pumpkin pancakes and my fiancé choose one of their skillets. We also got coffees and OJ (the OJ tasted weird and cost $5.00, only had a sip) but the food was good and the service was excellent. I would definitely recommend this place when in town.
Your typical diner. Love the simple traditional American food: pancakes, french toasts, burgers, soups... Would not recommend any item too fancy on the menu though

It's your typical brunch place.  Food is fine (but seriously how hard is it to make pancakes?) and, as you would expect, overpriced.  I would have given 3 stars, but had an interesting disagreement with the waiter - and then the manager - after we were charged an extra $10 for my friend's side of pancakes.  We were told by the manager that they don't do sides, only full orders, which is a detail that the waiter apparently didn't know, or neglected to tell us.  The manager took it off our bill, but was a total jerk about it, so here you go buddy, 2 stars for everyone to see.  Won't be back.

Lovely menu. Very expansive. You may choose something basic or something off the wall as well. We came here for breakfast and I choose an off the wall option. The Paris Benedict. Try it. The eggs on it were perfectly poached. The most beautiful I have ever seen. I'll be back next time I visit Chicago.
Yummy food. There were a lot of people and we waited for about 40 minutes. It was worth for waiting such long time. The egg was great.

Not your traditional brunch spot, but Nookies hits the spot in terms of size and quality.  These BYOB breakfast/brunch locale hits the spot in terms of large, quality breakfasts. While not as trendy as many of the other restaurants in the area, the service makes up for it.  If you're eating here on the weekends try to get in a little earlier otherwise you could be looking at a longer wait.

We went here before seeing a show at second city.  Wait staff: A++, very attentive and friendly Atmosphere: B-, it was very dirty. Base boards were caked with debris, there were cob webs around the lights, floors needed vacuumed and shampooed.  Food... let's see... The chicken noodle soup was hot and tasted okay but was out of a can. My husband said his salad tasted like an old fridge. We both ordered the maple smoked chicken, with mashed potatoes and veggies. The food was VERY plentiful and very hot. However, the gravy on the potatoes sort of tasted like dog food, but the potatoes were good. The steamed veggies were good. The chicken was kind of dry and had not the best flavor. In all, it is comparable to any other standard diner food. I will probably not be back, because when we go to chicgao, we typically like a bit tastier food.  Ps.. the prices were a tad on the high side. 16 dollars for each chicken dinner. But that's chicgao, I guess.

Wow! What a great find. My wife and I were visiting Chicago and ask for a good local restaurant and Nookies came highly recommended. We could not agree more. The breakfast both days was amazing! This one is book marked for our next visit to Chicago.

We were in Chicago for a long weekend and found Nookies to be one of our best breakfast spots. I had the smokehouse frittata and my boyfriend had one of their skillets. We both wanted to go back again but didn't have enough time, would highly recommend!
One of my favorite places in the city for breakfast.  Friendly, attentive, and accommodating staff.  Delicious food and a consistently good experience.  Priced very good.
A very short walk from the Hotel Lincoln where we were staying. The service is amazing and fast. The portions are very large and very tasty. I had one one the skillets and could only eat half.

The food at the restaurant was actually pretty good. The host (who may have been the owner) was extremely friendly. However, the service is the reason Nookie's gets 2 stars. In town wth my family, the server is no where to be found close to 10 mins after being seated. Thankfully the bus boy could tell we were agitated and felt bad so he came over to ask us for drink orders and fill waters. Minutes later, he could tell we were still searching for our waiter so he came over and asked if we had been helped yet. When we said no, you could tell he was embarrassed and searched for the server. The server comes over, as if he were agitated he was being asked to do his job, and says "what will you have today?" Perhaps an acceptance that you're busy and running slightly behind and an apology would help defuse. The remainder of the brunch, he's short, and overall unfriendly. As we walk out, he walks past us, makes eye contact and you would think this would be a good time to thank us for coming in. Ha, you knew that wasn't coming. Silence instead. Of course I mentioned it to the owner as we walked out. I told him, I understand places get busy and perhaps you're short staffed; however, this is NOT the type of service you would ever want to hold your own business accountable to. Regardless, my mom picked up the check and bless her heart wouldn't give less than 15%. Lucky guy.

Large portions, served piping hot to the table. BYOB. Efficient turnover of tables so even if you have to put your name on a list with the host, it won't take long before you're seated. The standard breakfast combinations are available with some rotating specials like steak & eggs tostada or crab cakes. Worth a visit if you want to have a boozy brunch without breaking the bank or want a laid back vibe with solid service.
Great food and exceptional service. Would eat there again. Kind of a mom and pop restaurant.

Solid breakfast and brunch place.....Have been here a few times while visiting Chicago because of the recommendation of a friend...Service has always been average to solid along with the food.....Will definitely revisit for those reason's alone!
Great food, service and atmosphere! It's always packed for a reason! Love this place.

Nookies is the one place in Chicago I'm proud to be a regular at. Jessica is my favorite server, and she always makes the experience wonderful. My coffee snob friends love this place. and their dessert is the bomb. Seriously, I used to work at a b&b, and we still wonder how their french toast is this amazing. Thank you for continuing to be the best breakfast in Chicago.

Very yummy and service was great. We were immediately seated and coffee was always refilled. We went for breakfast and it was delicious. We had the Dixie Benedict and Steak and Egg Tostada and both were very satisfying. Highly recommend Nookie's for breakfast. Easygoing, diner atmosphere and relaxed staff who are still attentive.

Nookies is where I go when I want a closeby brunch with decent food that's BYOB. (Elly's down the street has better food but no BYOB so for this reason alone Nookies wins. Seating is a hit or miss. Arrive too close to noon, and you'll most certainly have a 20 minute wait. The crowd tends to be younger (20's-30's). As for the food, it's OK. Nothing to brag about but there's a good variety and the prices are around the $10 mark (cheaper than Elly's). No corkage fee and relatively friendly service. It's one of those restaurants that is what it is, and still everyone goes..and drinks.

We ate at Nookie's on Wells the last two days.  If it didn't have the famous name, I'm certain it would be empty. But, it was jammed with 20+ minute waits both days - not bad.  But . . .  Both days we weren't offered our first coffee refill until we were almost done eating; and weren't offered a second refill at all. The Mexican skillet with chorizo was very homogeneous and tasted like and had the consistency of processed factory food almost like baby food.  It all seemed squeezed out of a Kirkland bag and microwaved. Yuk. But we gave it a second shot the next day and ordered  Eggs Benedict - by far the worst we've ever had.  The Hollandaise sauce on the menu was replaced by a disgusting lemon sauce (on Eggs Benedict!).  Sweet/sour rather than savory sauce on poached eggs??  We had to bathe it in hot sauce to choke it down.  The eggs were not at all tasty, and a little soggy.  The Canadian bacon had barely touched a pan - seemed like it was dropped onto the English muffin straight out of a cold package.  The English muffin too was so lightly toasted it seemed dropped onto the plate from the package.  All of it looked and tasted like it was assembled from packages rather than home cooked.  No care at all was given to making this meal, and it was unpleasant to eat.  That's a disgrace in any event, but at an average ticket of $20 per person, it's also a crime.  Just plain gross.

I love this place. Every time I come to Chicago this is my must go to brunch location. They are creative with their dishes and I have to say some of them are crave worthy - note the smokehouse frittata. The wait can sometimes (often) be a bit, but it is always worth it.

I left here feeling pretty underwhelmed by both the food and ambiance. We had stopped by here on Sunday just past noon and the place was bumpin'! We had to hang out for 20 minutes or so for a table of two but no biggie as the hanger didn't quite hit in yet.  Once seated, I ordered their huevos con chorizo which consisted of scrambled eggs, Mexican chorizo sausage, potatoes, & chihuahua cheese and served with a side of rice, beans, and flour tortillas. I think the biggest disappointment was the chorizo which was pretty unrecognizable as chorizo to be honest. Sort of just tasted like deconstructed sausage and was pretty bland overall. Eggs were cooked well as were as the potatoes and I ended up constructing two mini breakfast burritos with the tortillas. But overall still kind of meh.  I think the biggest attraction for this place is the fact they are a diner that is BYOB. Just about every other table or so had a bottle of champagne popped and another table even brought a full handle of grey goose and an arsenal of mixers. Those guys knew what's up! Other than that the food wasn't very good in my opinion, and there were at least a dozen fruit flies buzzing around our table which kind of made me lose my appetite. Anyways, hard to say I'll be back on this one. 'Til next time!

Environment is friendly and the wait isn't too long on a nice day. Be sure to bring a bottle of champagne if you want to keep the mimosas flowing as this place is BYOB (order a pitcher of freshly squeezed OJ!) Nice specials menu and staff is attendant. All in all, decent brunch and friendly atmosphere.
Exactly what I want for brunch spot, great food & great service!.  I had the "the good ol' boy" and I'm so glad I came hungry.  It was filling but I couldn't stop eating it!
Nookies is our go to brunch spot! The owners/staff are super friendly & they turnover tables fast. Never disappointed -- plus great that I can get rewarded for my visits with Belly!

I've come to Nookies a few times now and each time I try something new. The menu has good variety but I've never been really impressed with any of the items I've ordered. Everything is very bland and boring. Stuff people can make at home honestly. It reminds me of an elderly homey diner. The service I have had mixed opinions on. I've had great service and I've had horrible service but I suppose that comes with every place. I wouldn't rate this place as horrible but it's nothing I would ever go out of my way for and I live down the street.

We wanted to give all the neighborhood brunch spots a fair shot so we tried nookies out a few weeks back.  We had heard a lot of good things about this place and figured it was worth a shot. 3 stars is not a knock by any means.  The food was good, service was good, and you weren't packed in there like sardines at other places.  It's definitely a good spot but don't expect to be blown away by anything.

It was okay. I had a frittata and it was a little over cooked. It also had peas. I took a chance and probably wouldn't order that again. It just didn't add flavor to the eggs. I'm willing to go again and try something else. My husband had a trio of pancakes and loved the cherry flavored one bit was just okay on the toffee flavored one. Fun presentation. The coffee was very tasty.

According to my family who have lived in Old Town area, it's rather difficult to find breakfast eateries. Nookies is one of a few in the area, I was told.   It's spacious inside unlike Elly's or Kanela, but to me, it reminds me of one of easier to find Mid-west breakfast restaurants. In terms of quality and taste of their plates, they're not bad at all but also nothing special. Still I never had any bad experience, and whichever the plates I ordered, they were fine. If you're coming in as a larger group or with small children but not looking for some incredible plates, then Nookies could be a good fit.

Great little neighborhood place! We stopped on a (hungry) whim and we are glad we did! Versatile menu - we had everything from breakfast to BLT to roasted chicken and beef stroganoff. Recommend highly!

ALL the food was fresh and cooked to how we ordered.  The service was very friendly and inviting.  Prices are reasonable for the quality of the food.  It's easy to tell they take pride in serving the people and serving smiles !

Ok I admit it. I'm a brunch snob. Most of the time I feel like I can make a pretty good breakfast at home, for half the price, and without the wait. But today was different. After a 5k in Lincoln Park, a friend offered to treat and I suggested walking over to Nookies. A little before 10 o'clock, we only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated at a table for 2. I was actually surprised to find the place is bigger than it looks and has 3 different rooms, able to accommodate groups of all sizes. I also noticed lots of kids and families, along with younger people enjoying (byoc) mimosas - a good crowd mix overall. So after settling in with our coffee (I mean, first thing's first!), we perused the myriad of menu options and decided to split 2 dishes: the combo crepes and the artichoke frittata with hash browns. Both were super delicious. I especially loved the strawberry and sweet cheese flavors for the crepes. And the frittata with hash browns was a really decent serving size for your money. My only regret is not taking any pictures before digging in!

Love this place - such a homey and welcoming vibe. The restaurant is located in a great area where you can walk around afterwards. The owners (I think?) of this place are so friendly and remind me of my grandparents. The Farmers Egg skillet taste incredibly fresh and the portions are huge!! I had enough leftover for another meal.

Great food and great service.  Has a family-owned vibe that comes through in the attitudes of the staff and in the careful preparation of the diverse dishes on the menu.  A local gem worth traveling too.

Nookies always delivers. ....I don't mean that literally.  I don't think they actually deliver, as in food to your door.  I mean I've never been disappointed in the 7+ years I've been eating at all their locations.

Stayed near here and decided to try it for breakfast after reading the reviews here.  It's a cozy place with friendly staff and a nice ambiance.   I had the crunchy French toast, which was phenomenal.  The corn flakes really added a nice dimension.  Also, I had the hash browns cooked exactly like I like them - shredded and crispy.  The employees were all very pleasant and our food came out very quickly.  We will definitely be back.

Staying in Lincoln park for a day and loved Nookies. All home made foods, fresh baked breads and very reasonable prices. We had scrambled eggs, with hash browns and toast with fresh squeezed orange juice. The raisin toast is awesome.
Great menu!!! So much to choose from. Had a breakfast sandwich that had veggies and Gouda. One if the best I've ever had!!

Ah, I hate giving this place a 3 stars but I've just really been to the best brunch spots ever. So it really depends on what you are looking for.  If you really don't care about having the best meal ever for brunch then please come on in here. Especially if you have kids- it's just to easy and nice. The servers will pick up anything your toddler will throw on the floor and even talk to them. If you have a weekday afternoon off- bring a bottle of champagne and buy a pitcher of OJ for 12 bucks and it's BYOB.  It's a chain- so long menus- basic food- basic restaurant. Sunny and shiny near the windows and a few loners around the bar with their laptop or just enjoying themselves in peace. Great place for an easy meet up especially in the Old Town area. Food is just not good!

I had a wonderful experience this morning. This was my first time and I'll definitely be back. The staff was very nice. I tried Cajun Eggs which is a "winter special". I believe the staff said it only has a couple days left on the menu. If you can make it before it goes I strongly suggest you do. There were eggs, Cajun gravy and shrimp atop hoe cakes. The meal was very flavorful. The menu is full of interesting choices that I'm eager to try.

This is a great breakfast spot. One of my favorites in Chicago. Really enjoy the food and the staff. The only problem with Nookies is there is always a line! Staff, service on point. Food A+. And it's in a great location.

I'm not sure what the hype is about here.. BYOB was great but the food was just alright. You also felt like you were sitting in a high school friend's parents basement. There are way too many great brunch options in Chicago to settle!
Perfect diner with a wide variety of food. My brother is obsessed with the crepes here. Obsessed.  And that's all I have to say about that. Jsckée

Came in for a quick late night meal Saturday and was pleasantly surprised how satisfied I was. I ordered the broccoli, Gouda and chicken sausage omelet and it was delicious! Highly recommend if you love Gouda :)

My daughter and I stayed the weekend at Hotel Lincoln and stumbled across Nookies while exploring the neighborhood. There was a long line of folks waiting which was a good sign the food was worthy of the wait. Twenty minutes after checking in we were seated and were eating ten minutes later. I ordered the special, a Mexican chicken stew with white beans and chilis topped with poached eggs - very hearty and delicious. My daughter enjoyed her pecan waffle and side of fruit and devoured the whole thing. Service was very friendly and efficient from welcoming us at the door to settling our bill. I am a Nookies fan and will definitely be back.

Love Nookie's. This location has a French Dip which is excellent. Also their chicken sandwiches are great,  chicken wrap is great & even their quesadilla is good. I love their chicken noodle soup, too. Staff here has been around for a while & do a great job!  Perfect spot for brunch,  lunch or even dinner. PS it's BYOB too!  Enjoy!

Nookies is an ok option for pretty much any meal, though they ted to be known more for their brunch/breakfast offerings. They offer a large menu with a wide variety of items, so anyone and everyone can come for a meal and be sure that they will find something that is to their liking. The coffee is good. Staff is generally friendly. The juice is actually fresh squeezed. The portions are huge (I usually get an extra meal or two thanks to the leftovers if I order an omelet). And, of course, they are BYOB, which is always a nice bonus.  So why only 3 stars? To be honest, I don't find Nookies to really be anything special. It always strikes me as a pretty standard diner with average food. I've had some okay meals, a few disappointing meals, but I've never had a really great meal here. Whether I am there for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, I've never had a meal that would cause me to truly recommend Nookies to others.  So, if you are in the area and in need of food, then Nookies is a perfectly acceptable option. However, I wouldn't go out of my way to visit and wouldn't wait more than 10 minutes to be seated.
Basic diner, good food. Decent prices for the location
Good size breakfast, large portions to star a day. Good variety of omelettes available.

Nookies is a wonderful neighborhood diner. Not only do they serve delicious, generously-portioned breakfast food all day, but the people who work there are great, and make Saturday morning or Sunday afternoon that much nicer. We always leave full and happy, with good memories and take-out boxes.

The service is incredible here. Their regular cup of coffee is pretty good. I ordered the Lemon Poppy Seed French toast which was AAMMMAAAZZZIIINNGGGG!!!! My fiancé ordered the multi-grain pancakes which he described as being really good and VERY filling. Great restaurant, we will be back!! :)

Really good breakfast food. Convenient and quick. Other than the breakfast items I haven't been super impressed. But if your looking for a relaxed spot for brunch this is a good spot. Also is byob, which is a major key.

Have gone twice and both times we're left wondering why the long lines on weekends.... I was expecting something on par with other top Chicago places but found it to have the food quality of a diner without the authentic charm of a Diner Grill or S&G.

3 stars because they  have some good ass coffee and the server was super nice!! Not sure his name, but he had cool glasses on.  Food was alright. They cooked it exactly how I liked it. However it wasn't AMAZING food. Same food as you would get at Golden Nugget. I ordered two eggs, hashbrowns, bacon and toast. Simple.  So it was A- Ok!  I would probably go back, for that coffee!

Stopped at Nookies after a visit to Second City. Great service by Ruben and the grandson of the founder.  Food was excellent, especially the Bistro burger which was cooked to spec. Side salad was generous and very fresh.  Highly recommend this place.

We went here for dinner and loved it! The service was great and quick. I loved their tea selection and I ordered soup and salad. The salad was much better than I expected and the soup was delicious. The best part was the atmosphere and the nice service. We will definitely come back whenever we're in Chicago.
Cute little breakfast joint! Love how it's BYOB and it just feels like home. Not the best, not the worst.  A-OK Nookies.

If you're craving pancakes, waffles,bacon or sausage, Nookies is the best! If you're craving omelets and hash browns, Nookies is the best! If you're craving hot soup and sandwiches...ok, you get my point. You can never go wrong with Nookies.  The staff is friendly (one server NEVER writes down your order and no matter how complicated or large your party he gets everything right. Don't know how he does it). The service is quick. This place is always packed for breakfast, brunch and lunch. Yet the table turnaround is quick. I've never waited more than 20 minutes and that's when we had a party of 10!  You'll usually pay between $10-$15 per person and take home food because the portions are large. Great deal!
Steak & blue cheese sandwich is fantastic :) The orange juice is really good too, as are the waffles. It's nice and warm in there and the service is good.

Corned beef Ruben, side of fries with a coffee and soup, made a pretty great and tasty lunch for $10.95. Loved the water carafe on the table, thought it was cute and really enjoyed the coffee. Great place, I would probably return if I was in the area again.
favorite breakfast place in Lincoln Park, maybe the whole city.  sooooo good!
Food is always wonderful. Music volume is horrible. Very hard to carry on a conversation with tablemates. Asked waiter to turn it down and he did. Management turned it back up. Booooo!

Last weekend I visited Nookies with a group of friends. We had a 12 o'clock reservation and our party of 15 arrived on time. When you make a reservation there's an expectation that your table will be ready when you arrive but we still ended up waiting nearly 45 minutes to be seated. That's unacceptable in my opinion. What's the point of even making a reservation if you're still going to have to wait anyway? We finally got seated and had to wait another 15 minutes or so for menus. We were seated at two different tables that were adjacent to each other. However we weren't served at the same rate of speed. One table had finished eating their food before the other table had even been served!! Luckily everyone was good natured about it and went with the flow. I ordered pancakes, bacon and eggs. There was a special for about  $9 but the server rang everything al a carte which ended up being more expensive. I was annoyed but I didn't complain. There were too many of us even bother with it.  The service was ok. Our waiter was efficient but he was like a robot. He wasn't personable at all. He took the orders, dropped off the food and that was it. He never came back to check on us or anything.  The food was ok. The pancakes were overcooked so they were dry and tough to cut. The eggs and bacon were edible but nothing special. Overall, I just wasn't impressed. Even still I'd be inclined to give the place another shot. The location is convenient and the environment is cozy enough.  Even though everyone in the group was unimpressed by the lackluster service we still tipped the waiter well over 20%. It is Christmas after all....

My first food stop while visiting Chicago was to Nookies for a quick breakfast with friends. My boyfriend Brett and I had been up all night driving from Charlotte and I was ready for some delicious nom noms. The ambience was a down-home family style diner with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The greeters at the door were phenomenal while we had a short wait we were offered hot coffee and after sharing we had been on the road for 14+ hours the staff said they would "keep the coffee flowing". We appreciated the humor and the coffee. I had heard through friends the skillets were delicious but I was craving some vegetables so I opted for the smoked gouda (.... ahem need I say more???) tomato, mushroom and spinach egg sandwich with a side of fruit. Brett went with his gut and instantly chose "the hangover" skillet; potatoes smothered with chili, poached eggs and sour cream.  I wasn't overly excited about my breakfast sandwich (best part was the cheese) but the skillet was a hit!!  So why the "3" rating you may ask?  While the service at the beginning of our experience was spot on, the food filled our bellies and was overall cooked well, what put the bad taste in my mouth was our server.  Having spent 6+ years working in the restaurant business waiting tables and tending bar I generally give my servers a good bit of slack when I see they are "in the weeds" however our server wasn't too busy, and when he did spend time with us he was very short and abrupt in his conversation. After the meal was over and checks had been paid, the server returned to us the receipts and pens without saying anything to us, no "thank you for coming", "I appreciate it" etc...Although I do not penalize servers for their attitudes and always tip 20% + , service is one of the main reasons I return to a restaurant.
Very friendly place with great food and a good vibe. Stopped here late after viewing the lights at Lincoln Park Zoo. The homemade potato chips are delicious!

My husband and I had a destination wedding in Chicago, we all stayed at the Hotel Lincoln down the street.  We needed take out breakfast food for everyone the morning of the wedding.  We ordered an assortment of frittatas, omelettes, and eggs. The food was outstanding and held us over until the afternoon! And very reasonably priced! If ever in the area again, we will definitely get breakfast here.

Finally got around to checking out this place and (based off current reviews) it was underwhelming for brunch. It's a family-style diner with so-so ambiance and minimal to no wait time.  I had the Farmers Eggs skillet and my group tried the Denver Omelette, Breakfast Sandwich with Hash Brown, and the Two Eggs with French Toast. None of it was bad but there wasn't anything remarkable or memorable about the food. It is BYOB so we did enjoy making our mimosas once we got a carafe of OJ.  The main motivations I'd consider for visiting Nookies in Old Town: -Location (quaint neighborhood) -BYOB (can't knock BYOBs!) -Minimal to no wait time for Saturday morning brunch (strolled in at 11AM) -Friendly staff The missing component is food that knocks your socks off! And to follow through with that metaphor... my socks were firmly on my feet the whole time. :(
Yummy food... Turkey burger, fries, soup... Great customer service by Hayley!!! Smiling face... Happy to be here... Good conversation...

We came early on a Sunday morning.  The place was busy,  but not packed.  I have nothing bad to say.  The coffee was hot,  the orange juice freshly squeezed,  the food yummy and plentiful. And from the time we walked in the door to the time we were eating it was 10, 15 minutes at the most. A great meal all around.
Great place for many reasons... the food is delish, space is cozy and the staff are great. You must try thr home made chicken and rice soup! Really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Stopped in early Thanksgiving morning with my nephew (with severe food allergies) because my sister in law had thrown out her back and had an emergency visit with the chiropractor across the street (a great guy - who comes in to treat a patient on Thanksgiving morning?!). Anyway, my nephew was hungry and I went to the counter at Nookies to place a to-go order - told the server we needed a strange, off-menu order - purple grapes and a glass of milk to go. I think a lot of servers would wrinkle their nose or roll their eyes at an order like that, but not Kenzie, our sweet server. She was as friendly and warm as could be and had it ready to go in just a few minutes - along with a bagel for me - no questions asked. I mention this, because it was such a small thing, but set the tone for a great day. I really could've cried when I saw how carefully the grapes had been packaged in a cup - all taken off the stems - so kind. Nookies is very lucky to have Kenzie at their counter. She made our day!

Great breakfast place or casual lunch in Lincoln park. Young and mixed crowd and very vibrant . Local feel. Extensive menu and great brunch/ breakfast menu. Omelette was great and service was warm and friendly. We will be back.

Been to a few of these, this one was clean. Others have been down right dirty. All of them need to be remodeled. French dip bread was fresh and soft,not enough beef and the aujus was terrible, side of fruit was fresh cold and perfect. Host was great, server was awesome.

Phenomenal! Cozy little restaurant with a quiet atmosphere. I'm from out of state and found this place on yelp and loved it. Came on a Monday morning, no wait, good service. My food was sooooooooo good. Very fresh and tasty, and it's not very expensive. I would recommend coming here.

Had a decent meal here on a Sunday around mid-morning during their brunch rush. More of a family atmosphere than I'd expected but then again, consider the neighborhood. No bar, so beware if a boozy brunch is on your agenda. Waited about ten minutes for a table for 3. Seated in the back and noted the place could use some TLC (light fixtures hanging on the wall, outdated diner motif). Our waiter was notably unfriendly--never even cracked a smile. That being said, service was quick and the food was average. One person in our group had the Eggs Florentine and barely made it halfway through due to how heavy the meal was.
The food was okay. One meal we ordered was great, the other was very bland. All in all though, the restaurant has a good atmosphere. Black bean soup was great.
Great neighborhood diner-type spot. Lots of choices. Good quality and clean. Lots of regulars. Quick service. Right prices.

Nookies is an amazing BYOB brunch spot! I went with 6 friends on a Saturday and they sat us fairly quickly. We brought champagne and ordered flutes of orange juice to make mimosas. I ordered the mexican omelette with guacamole and fresh fruit and it filled me for the entire day. It was absolutely delicious! My friend got the farmer's scramble which also looked amazing. Will definitely go again!

We came in for a late brunch at around 1 PM on a Sunday.  The place was still packed and we had to wait for a table, but only for about 5 minutes.  Atmosphere and decor is of an old school diner.  They also have an outdoor seating area, but wasn't set up due to the colder weather.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. Food-wise, this place is great.  All the typical diner options which they do right.  I got the Dixie Benedict: poached eggs, ham, and biscuits covered in sausage gravy and served with has browns.  Great comfort food and hangover cure.  GF had a special: black bean fritters and said that was fantastic. Overall, it was a great brunch experience.  Our only issue was the price of the drinks.  When we first sat down, we both ordered a water and orange juice (large - 8 oz).  It wasn't until we got the bill that we saw the juice was $4.25 EACH.  Can't be too upset as the price is clearly marked on the menu, which we didn't look at.  Common sense would put the juice at a MAX of $2 per glass, so we ordered without looking.  For the $8.50 we paid for our non-alcoholic drinks, we could have just went to the Walgreens down the street and gotten 2 gallons of orange juice.  "Fresh squeezed" or not, that wasn't worth it.  We'll be coming back, but just getting water next time!

I would describe my experience as "fine." I had the Monterey chicken sandwich which was incredibly underwhelming. The 'fries' were soggy and tasteless. The cream of chicken soup that came as a starter however was tasty. My friend got the apple french toast which she liked. We were both underwhelmed by the fresh-squeezed orange juice. Also they charge for coffee. FYI.  I won't be back: if I want to pay $10+ for breakfast, I'm going somewhere else.

I HIGHLY recommend going to Nookies if you are ever in Chi-town. I would have to say that this is the best brunch I have ever had in my entire life. I had a Benedict. It was two pieces of Texas Toast topped with two eggs, creamy hollandaise sauce, and the meat was thick, meaty slices of bacon cooked to perfection. A wonderful twist was asparagus in the mix as well. I have never had something so dreamy in all my life!

Had breakfast early on a Sunday; no crowds or noise at that time. It's a small place so I can see it would be a complete zoo in the later hours. Coffee was tasty and smooth. Had the artichoke frittata and it was outstanding; fresh cooked artichoke hearts, not canned. Toast was cut thick. Portions were large. Good options for vegetarians.

Whether you are looking for brunch, lunch or dinner Nookies hits the spot. I've had sandwiches, salads, breakfast it's all SO so fresh and delicious. Huge omelettes, killer eggs Benedict, great burger, and tasty Caesar wrap. I frequent this place quite a bit, but I usually get it to go because the wait is always so long on the weekends and I'm impatient. Plus I live close so it's easy and convenient. Bonus: they give you a cup of soup with your order which adds a nice touch. Stay cool Nookies.

Came tonight with my friend who highly recommended me this place for dinner and left highly disappointed. The waiter came to take our order but we were not ready and then ignored us for good half an hour. When he finally came back to the table, he took my order and totally ignored my friend. I told him that my friends wants to order some food as well, and he just ignored me and left to take care of the other table with words :"I don't understand". Totally unprofessional and rude! We did not have any other choice but leave and go find some other place to eat, since we were starving. Please, save your time and go somewhere else if you want to have your dinner the same night!

It was good, but not amazing. My omelette was average (southwest?). The pancakes were...simple... like eating breakfast at IHOP. I was expecting a little more... The location is nice, quiet. If that's your thing, then you're going to like this place.

Yum! Went there yesterday and had the Gouda, mushroom, onion and bacon Fritatta. My husband had the raspberry peach French toast. Good coffee. The only negative was that they had a group of summer special items that sounded great but most weren't available until 9am. That's on the late side if you have a toddler, which we do, so we were there around 8am. We don't live in this area but still would come back during our next Chicago visit.

I really LOVE this place. I've been several times and its always consistent. (casual breakfast place that pumps out GREAT creative dishes while still doing the basics right!) In its class, It's a five star for me!

First breakfast in Chicago.  Must say it was very delicious.  I ordered eggs over corned beef hash.  Cooked perfectly.  Only reason I don't give 5 stars is because I prefer home fries over the shredded potatoes.  However; the shredded potatoes were very delicious!

Good for BYOD.  Probably should have redecorated about 10 years ago as it looks like the late 90's in here!  Still, it's not terrible and the food is average to fair.  Eggs were basic as was the fruit, but hey what you gonna do.  If you're in a hurry try elsewhere.

Fresh OJ that is so perfect with one of the best Monte Cristo sandwiches I've had in many years. In fact I'm having my local brunch place try to recreate it as I write this review. Fruit plate was freshly cut and not store bought and dumped in a bowl. Next time on north side of Chicago I will make sure to eat here again.
Good food! I wish we would've sat outside to enjoy the scenery.  buuuut I still loved what I ate! Everything tastes homemade & delicious!

Nookies is hands down my favorite brunch spot in Old Town. Nice outside seating for those who like the outdoors and people watching. It gets very busy on the weekends. But I've found no difference in the service or taste of food. My go to dish is the farmer's skillet. Yum! Can't go wrong with big portions and byo champagne for mimosas :)
Awesome place and good service. Food was tasty and everyone was nice. Good neighborhood place to grab brunch on weekends.

After having brunch here, I am shocked that this place has four stars. I had scrambled eggs and hash browns, which should be pretty difficult to mess up. However, both were covered in Pam kitchen spray, as if it had been used instead of butter or oil to cook with. My boyfriend had a daily special, which was a Mexican inspired steak and eggs. It was edible after adding quite a bit of hot sauce. We also ordered two coffees. After asking three different people at three different times for milk or cream it never arrived. Overall, not a four star place by any means.

I came in for breakfast. The meeting you had some great choices . The waitstaff was very friendly. I got the pancakes and an egg dish. The pancakes were a bit overcooked . Eggs were fine. But the house was undercooked. I was hoping for more out of this place.

First timers here... Loved this place! 5 stars from me, 4 from the husband.  We walked up and I loved it from the start. Very cute and has a nice patio area; we knew it was gonna be good because of the amount of people standing around outside waiting for tables. We figured we would be out there waiting for awhile- but it was only 10-15 minutes, just as the host had said.  We were seated inside. The place has such a great diner feel- but different because its a bit more classy. Our waitress was super friendly and kind, and took great care of us! Thanks to other Yelp reviews, we got the fresh squeezed orange juice... it was SO GOOD. We are from Florida and recently moved here to Chicago. THIS is the stuff Floridians live for. It was perfect. We also enjoyed watching the juicing machine. They were putting whole oranges in, peel and all, and juice came pouring out. Intriguing.  I ordered the Chili-Avocado fritatta with hash browns. It was phenomenal and such a huge portion, I barely finished half. I wasn't a huge fan on the hash- kinda tasteless and needed quite a bit off pepper. I didn't eat much of it. The fritatta though. Oh. My. Word. I wanna eat that for breakfast every morning. Just as the waitress described it- a bed of eggs with chili, all this awesome melted cheese, and avocado. Yum.  My husband had the Bistro burger. Bleu cheese and carmelized onions on a 1/4 lb beef patty. He really liked it, although it wasn't exactly cooked how he had asked. He asked for medium, and it came out almost well done. Not a huge deal, and he was starving and just wanted to eat, haha. Overall he said it was a pretty good burger.  One thing that my husband would like me to add is that he was so sad he didn't order the huge stuffed french toast stuff we saw come out of the kitchen soo many times. Seriously, he is very remorseful. We will definitely be back to Nookies (can I just mention how much I love that name?! so cute) and we will have to try the french toast :)
The French toast was really good! I enjoyed the special french toast with the vanilla bean cream cheese especially. :)

Well, it has been a few years since I visited Nookies and nothing has changed.  The food is even better than I remember.  I have a different perspective now as I have an 18 month old son.  My review is a little different this time but it still keeps its 5 stars.  Their childrens menu is great.  He had the pigs in a blanket (pancake wrapped around a sausage link).  He loved it and it came with a chocolate milk, all for only $3.50.  They were accommodating to all kids (there were a ton there) and it just made the experience even better. If my son could actually say sentences he would say "This place rocks!!!!"

Best freaking place in the city for breakfast. The best omelettes. Really... The best vegetarian omelette you can get. Incredible French toast. Their food is excellent. Stupid long wait on weekends. I love the U shaped counter.
We ordered the seasonal trio breakfast sampler, and it was absolutely amazing! It was such a sweet treat. The fruit was incredibly fresh and perfect on top of the French toast and pancakes!

I found Nookies to be good, not great.  I had the steak and eggs special.  The steak was overcooked, and quite a few pieces were grizzly.    The guac and scrambled eggs were good.  The refried beans and rice were fine - nothing special. One thing that I found annoying about the menu is that breakfast options are listed in a number of places, so you have to hunt around a bit. This place was great for kids - the chocolate chips pancakes were a hit and cheap. If I were eating carbs, I would try the french toast dipped in corn chips. That sounded really good.

I couldn't wait to eat here. We showed up for Sunday breakfast to sit outside (had a dog) but outdoor was not set up, so we had to go elsewhere. Maybe next time. Restaurant should prepare outdoor seating before restaurant even opens!!
Just went here yesterday.... It was a decent little mom and pop spot.... But for me personally... Nothing to rave about

My boyfriend and I went there today since we are trying to do a brunch thing every Saturday and since we saw that they had good reviews, we said why not. We got there around 2pm and were seated promptly. Our server (forgot this name) was very nice. We both ended up ordering the 2 eggs, 2 sides of bacon and 2 pancakes meal, which to be honest, it was nothing I couldn't make at home, if not better. The price was I believe 8.95 for that meal, which isn't bad but it was basic. We then ordered a thing of crepes and the flavors we got were apple cinnamon, strawberry and creamy cheese (or something like that) The strawberry and apple were very basic as well, it was a crepe with fruit in it essentially, no whip cream or any kind of drizzle but the creamy cheese was amazing, I would recommend that over the others! Aside from the food being basic, the place itself seemed worn down; the carpet was disgusting as well as the tile. When I walked into the bathroom, there were two stalls, one stall had poop alllllll over it, and it was disgusting. That took off sanitary points for me. Overall, I would not ever go here again and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone as well. I didn't have a bad experience or bad nor great customer service but the food is sub par and the place felt dirty.
Delicious brunch spot close to the Zoo. Got the Paris Benedict and tried the crepes combo (strawberry, cheese, Apple). Both items were great!

This is my go-to breakfast spot. Anytime family is visiting or I need an afternoon to myself, I find myself in Nookies. With their seasonal menu and consistently amazing food I keep going back. I love the outdoor seating, the big windows in the front, and the strong coffee! This is the perfect place for a cozy date in the dead of winter, or a sunny sidewalk breakfast for summer.

Exceptional...the breakfast items had both classic and unique options, all absolutely well worth trying and enjoying. Very fresh ingredients. Great helpings, service was superb and I agree with a fellow person, the fresh OJ is a must to order!

I was looking for a brunch place close by to Second City and found this. I would probably give it 3.5 stars if that was an option because it wasn't bad (I would go back) but it also wasn't anything exceptional either--it's just a standard brunch/American spot. My boyfriend and I split the tuna melt and an omelet. The tuna melt was pretty good (classic tuna on an english muffin with melted american cheese), but nothing that I couldn't make easily at home. The omelet was great: huge, veggie-stuffed and super cheesy, but again, nothing different than any other omelet I've had at a brunch place. With our orders, we also got a side of onion rings (yummy but greasy) and hash-browns (eh, only okay, I've had better). One particularly frustrating/bizarre thing about our meal was that the tuna melt comes with a side of chicken & rice soup, but we are vegetarian. We told the waiter that we can't eat meat and asked to sub it for a side salad or a different side instead, but the waiter told us: "no, we can't do that because the soup is just complimentary." Seriously, what's up with that? Kind of ridiculous...

perfect food & service. Visiting from California ran across this place on the way to the zoo. So glad we stopped. Server made great suggestions. Fresh squeezed orange juice was amazing... the plus we met Aaron Franklin from bbq pits here. You know food critics don't just eat any where ;) Ps. My bothers said to make sure I add finger kicking good (:  Thank you Nookies!!
Always a quality meal for a decent price! Service is always good. It's a great neighborhood spot, wish there were more Nookies.
Food so good, it had me smiling from ear to ear! A quaint cozy place - definitely recommend!

Nookies was suggested to us by a native and it just happened to be walking distance from our hotel.  We came here for our breakfast our first morning.  We were greeted and seated immediately by a very friendly manager.  The breakfast menu had some impressive creations, Jess went with the special for the day, a trout skillet, and just for the heck of it I had a pecan Belgium waffle.  The food was great, our service was impeccable.  They kept the water and coffee filled.  (Warning - the coffee was pretty strong, it made for an interesting rest of the morning.) We were really happy with this breakfast, and I'll definitely come back when I'm next in town!

I love Nookies! It's the best place in the neighborhood to grab a quick and simple breakfast or lunch (and dinner, but I've never been there for dinner). I believe they serve their entire menu all day, which is really nice when you sometimes have the tendency to wake up after 2pm and all you really want is bacon and eggs (over medium with one of the best English muffins I've ever had in my life). Plus it's BYOB!  Also their patio is nice in the summer and dog friendly, so inevitably I try to bring my dog whenever possible. Definitely can't wait until it warms up so I can hang with my dog while drinking my own champagne and noshing on some eggs and bacon!

Went in excited for good service and good food.. They wouldn't seat us if we expected one more person because they didn't want people hogging tables. They were not warm or welcoming and just didn't seem they like they cared that much about customers. Wound up going to a different break fav place that was SO much better. So thank you :)

I'm a little surprised that anyone could give this place anything above three stars. What am I missing? I don't really consider myself a picky eater, but this was one of the worst breakfasts I've ever had. Future diners, ignore my review at your peril. The coffee was sour, with a chemical aftertaste. The pancakes were dense and chewy. The omelette leaked oil and butter when I bit into it. And the hashbrowns were dry on top, and mushy and undercooked underneath. The entire meal was devoid of flavor top to bottom. Except for the English muffin, which was actually great. Also, freshly squeezed orange juice is a nice touch. Service was fine. I'd describe our server as someone who was told to be nice to kids but really didn't care for them. Which is fine. I've been to plenty of Chicago diners, but I'd avoid this one.

Pretty good breakfast food. My kiddo had the chocolate chip pancakes which were great, as was my husband's omelet. The hash, however, tasted like it came from a can. The service was friendly and the location convenient.

A ton of food and quality materials, but poorly crafted (soggy sandwich and almost too much food making it all fall apart) and really lacking depth of flavor. It felt like they were too reliant on an overload of carmelized onions to make up for having no additional flavors

Nookies! What can I say I had such a delightful experience this afternoon for brunch. This was my first visit but I heard many nice things about Nookies. I was surprised to find out how large the place actually was since it looks small from the outside. I love the small diner vibe and it seems like this is a family business which I always love about a place because you can feel that lovin' energy when you're there and it definitely reflects on the service and food. I ordered the Spring sampler special (pancake, french toast, and a some other sweet bread), it was fantastic! My boyfriend ordered the Paris benedict (broiche, bacon, asparagus, egg, and a gruyere gravy) - phenomenal. This meal may have been one of my best brunch experiences ever.  I have to note that the service was really great. The host(s) were incredibly sweet and accommodating. My boyfriend dropped me off at the front so I could put our name down while he looked for parking and the host was kind enough to just let me know that as soon as my bf walked in he would have our table ready, I was surprised to even find out that there was no wait! Brunch on a Sunday can be treacherous at so many places! The only con I can think of was that menu is kinda pricey.

Gotta love Nookies! Best place in Old Town to go for breakfast or brunch. I've had some of the skillets, steak and eggs, and pancakes - all excellent. Friendly service with good coffee. BYOB too so bring some champagne and OJ!
Went there twice for breakfast.  First time I had an omelette with spinach bacon and sausage.  The second was a veggie omelette.  The potatoes were lacking but the service was excellent.

So the only reason I'm giving this place a two is because it was close by and we got sat relatively fast on a Sunday morning.  I was visiting from out of town and yes....the portions are large. Yes the prices are low for the area. What wasn't great was the flavor... My cousin ordered a ham, cheese and broccoli omelet, tasted like broccoli....and only broccoli. I ordered chocolate chip pancakes, chewy. Enough said. And I also got the biscuits with gravy on them....bland. I am a huge brunch fan....and for my last meal this was a really big disappointment. Coffee....sour. Something was not right. I wish I could say something good about some part of the meal but I cannot.  Service.......wow. Not only did the waiter never make eye contact he walked away when I was still ordering. He seemed to be in a pissy mood....learn to act like ur happy even if you aren't, you work in the service industry! This is not my only review during my trip so I am not being biased...I had plenty of great meals in Chicago. Visit Kanela breakfast club instead!! It's within walking distance

My friend and I travelled to Chicago from Boston. We are spending the day in Lincoln Park and decided to stop off at Nookies for some brunch. I was so pleasantly surprised at the high quality of everything from the aesthetics, to the very friendly (and attractive) staff! And of course I cannot even put into words how phenomenal the food was! My friend and I had some vegetable soup; best damn vegetable soup soup of my life! He had the bbq chicken sandwich and I had the farmers egg skillet... both of which were brought out super quick, but you could tell it was all very well made, and tasted out of this world! If you are looking for a homey diner with that retro feel and amazing inexpensive food this is for sure the place to go! Families, old people, hipsters, whatever-this is the place for u!

Finally made it to Nookies on a Wednesday morning at 7am. Very good food and nice staff. I had the Jalisco Breakfast Burrito with cheese. I asked for toast instead of the fruit cup or hash brown option and the waiter happily accommodated my request without charging us extra. The burrito was so simple, salsa, egg, avocado on a tomato  wrap, yet it was delicious and HUGE. My husband enjoyed his Denver omelette with hash browns and commented on how big the portions were for the cost. There wasn't anything fancy or out-of-the-ordinary, but the flavor was still very good and the atmosphere was welcoming. I would not hesitate to recommend Nookie's for breakfast, and will definitely be returning.

My friends and I decided to try Nookies based off of its Yelp reviews, and it was a wonderful spot for brunch on Valentine's Day! We got there around noon, and after a short wait, we were taken to our table and soon had menus and coffee in front of us. I was a little disappointed by the coffee (bitter to the point were cream couldn't even help), but the rest of the menu made up for it. There were a ton of options ranging from the basic toast and eggs, to sandwiches, to steak. I didn't get the sense that this was the healthiest menu in the world, but I came with the intention of treating myself - so, I ordered the blueberry pancakes and a side of whole wheat toast, scrambled eggs, and hash browns. In our group of four, I was that person with three enormous plates of food in front of me (and all for less than $20). The portions were very generous, and the pancakes were fluffy and full of fresh berries. Despite my best efforts, I couldn't clear any of my plates. In short, as long as you aren't diligently watching your calorie-count, Nookies is great for a laid back meal with friends or family.

The food was very good. We both got Cajun eggs breakfast special. It was so delicious. The orange juice is also very good. You can tell its freshly squeezed. The only thing was that I asked the waiter if there were onions in my food and he said no. I did see a few onions in my food. I simply pushed them to the side because the food was still really good. The waiter was friendly and he continued to check on us. I would definitely recommend this place. The music is very fitting. It's an old school feel. Very relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. The tables are slightly close to each other but besides that the layout is great.
